Generation I.Red: Stiffens its ears to sense danger. The larger its horns, the more powerful its secreted venom.
Generation I.Green: (This entry was originally untranslated in English until it was reused in Pokémon FireRed .)
Generation I.Blue: Stiffens its ears to sense danger. The larger its horns, the more powerful its secreted venom.
Generation I.Yellow: Its large ears are always kept upright. If it senses danger, it will attack with a poisonous sting.
Generation I.Stadium: Its large ears sense danger. It extends its toxic spikes when angry. The size of its body thorns indicates its toxicity.

Generation II.Gold: It is small, but its horn is filled with poison. It charges then stabs with the horn to inject poison.
Generation II.Silver: It raises its big ears to check its surroundings. It will strike first if it senses any danger.
Generation II.Crystal: It constantly moves its large ears in many directions in order to detect danger right away.
Generation II.Stadium 2: It is small, but its horn is filled with poison. It charges then stabs with the horn to inject poison. (Pokémon Red, Silver, or Crystal inserted) It raises its big ears to check its surroundings. It will strike first if it senses any danger. (Pokémon Blue, Gold, or Yellow inserted)

Generation III.Ruby: The male Nidoran has developed muscles for moving its ears. Thanks to them, the ears can be freely moved in any direction. Even the slightest sound does not escape this Pok é mon 's notice.
Generation III.Sapphire: The male Nidoran has developed muscles for moving its ears. Thanks to them, the ears can be freely moved in any direction. Even the slightest sound does not escape this Pok é mon 's notice.
Generation III.Emerald: The male Nidoran has developed muscles that freely move its ears in any direction. Even the slightest sound does not escape this Pok é mon 's notice.
Generation III.FireRed: Its large ears are flapped like wings when it is listening to distant sounds. It extends toxic barbs when angered.
Generation III.LeafGreen: It stiffens its ears to sense danger. The larger its horns, the more powerful its secreted venom.

Generation IV.Diamond: It scans its surroundings by raising its ears out of the grass. Its toxic horn is for protection.
Generation IV.Pearl: It scans its surroundings by raising its ears out of the grass. Its toxic horn is for protection.
Generation IV.Platinum: It scans its surroundings by raising its ears out of the grass. Its toxic horn is for protection.

Generation IV.SoulSilver: It raises its big ears to check its surroundings. It will strike first if it senses any danger.

Generation VI.Y: Its large ears are flapped like wings when it is listening to distant sounds. It extends toxic barbs when angered.
Generation VI.Omega Ruby: Nidoran♂ has developed muscles for moving its ears. Thanks to them, the ears can be freely moved in any direction. Even the slightest sound does not escape this Pokémon's notice.

Generation VII.Let's Go Pikachu: Its large ears are always kept upright. If it senses danger, it will attack with a poisonous sting.
Generation VII.Let's Go Eevee: Its large ears are always kept upright. If it senses danger, it will attack with a poisonous sting.

Generation VIII.Sword: The horn on a male Nidoran's forehead contains a powerful poison. This is a very cautious Pokémon, always straining its large ears.
Generation VIII.Shield: Small but brave, this Pokémon will hold its ground and even risk its life in battle to protect the female it's friendly with.
Generation VIII.Brilliant Diamond: It scans its surroundings by raising its ears out of the grass. Its toxic horn is for protection.
Generation VIII.Shining Pearl: It scans its surroundings by raising its ears out of the grass. Its toxic horn is for protection.

Generation I.Blue: Route 22 , Safari Zone Trade Nidoran♀ in Underground Path (Kanto Routes 5–6) (Japanese Pokémon Red and Green only)
